metadata.synopsis: Vlaakith offers a last chance for Laezel to do her bidding and kill Orpheus, promising ascension. Player can suggest things, but not sure if it's going to have any long term impact.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Camp night becomes available as soon as the player enters Act3.Debug:- queue NIGHT_Laezel_VlaakithVisit- Make sure you have Laezel as Companion- Long rest in WYR_Main_A or CTY_Main_A

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: [KP] The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.NodeContext: With reverence.

83.speaker: Vlaakith
83.text: I named you Hshar'lak. Yet you still call me Queen.

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: Venerable Vlaakith. Please, I beg you to listen. I seek -
53.context: NodeContext: Will be interrupted by Vlaakith

94.speaker: Vlaakith
94.text: My forgiveness. Yes, I know - and I might yet grant it.

113.speaker: Vlaakith
113.text: You carry a ghaik parasite. You harbour the Heretic Prince. Yet so blind is your faith that you still call me Queen.

130.text: I have only a moment. And you, Hshar'lak, will listen.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers. Its power is waning.

124.speaker: Vlaakith
124.text: I have only a moment. And you, Hshar'lak, will listen.

118.speaker: Vlaakith
118.text: There's little time. I will speak, and you will listen.
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

96.speaker: Vlaakith
96.text: We are githyanki. We move mountains, we snuff out stars, we shake the planes.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

37.speaker: Vlaakith
37.text: The traitor Voss has lied to you. The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *Can this be true? Is the githyanki prince really a threat to his own people or simply a challenge to Vlaakith's rule?*
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

16.text: Return to the Astral Prism. Slay Orpheus the pretender.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

101.speaker: Vlaakith
101.text: Return to the Astral Prism. Slay Orpheus the pretender.

114.speaker: Vlaakith
114.text: Serve me and I will ascend you. You will be no mere warrior, nor kith'rak. You will be Baht t'Vlaakith.

138.speaker: Vlaakith
138.text: Commander of Dragons. My only, my Chosen.

98.speaker: Vlaakith
98.text: A final chance. Kneel before me. Make your promise.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Face the facts, Lae'zel. Vlaakith lied to your people. It's time you reject your queen.
34.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel has seen the truth of Vlaakith's lies

49.text: She - she has good reason, surely. Vlaakith is my faith, my - my very purpose.
49.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel has seen the truth of Vlaakith's lies

139.speaker: Lae'zel
139.text: She - she has good reason, surely. Vlaakith is my faith, my - my very purpose.
139.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel has seen the truth of Vlaakith's lies

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Link to Lae'zel's parasite, show her Vlaakith's mind.
1.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel has seen the truth of Vlaakith's lies

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: No. It can't be. I believed you - I believed everything.
26.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel has seen the truth of Vlaakith's lies

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: No. It can't be. I believed you - I believed everything.
70.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel has seen the truth of Vlaakith's lies

60.speaker: Vlaakith
60.text: Shka'keth! You speak against the Eternal Queen?

134.speaker: Lae'zel
134.text: I gave you my faith, and you called me traitor. I gave you my life, and you ordered your knights to hunt me.
134.context: NodeContext: Softly. but gradually more insistent.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Mother Gith's son lives, caged by a prison of your design. Our people deserve the truth - but you have denied it to us.
11.context: NodeContext: Not vehement, just rising in confidence

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: I have witnessed too much, and you have given me too little. Finally, I can see.
33.context: NodeContext: Not vehement, just rising in confidence

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: Orpheus will live, and I will hear his creed. This is my word.

76.speaker: Vlaakith
76.text: Your word is nothing. You are nothing.

103.text: The kith'raki will bring you. I will tear your flesh from your bones and devour your skull's marrow while you beg for death.

108.speaker: Vlaakith
108.text: The kith'raki will bring you. I will tear your flesh from your bones and devour your skull's marrow while you beg for death.

43.speaker: Vlaakith
43.text: I will consume you. I will unmake you!
43.context: NodeContext: As deranged as possible without having an aneurysm.

132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith's hologram flickers, then fades away.

12.text: Out of my head - the Queen has spoken!

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: Out of my head - the Queen has spoken!

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Poisoned by a life of propaganda. I pity you, Lae'zel.

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: And I pity your faithless mind.

140.text: And I pity your faithless mind.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: And I pity your faithless mind.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: So the worm bows to the wyvern. Have some dignity, stand up to Vlaakith!

97.speaker: Lae'zel
97.text: *Lae'zel's mind reels with images of Vlaakith, the Prism, and the githyanki prince inside it.*

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *Lae'zel's mind reels with images of Vlaakith, the Prism, and the githyanki prince inside it.*

10.text: I have my dignity. What I do not have is patience for your disloyalty.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.text: I have my dignity. What I do not have is patience for your disloyalty.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Go on, then. Kneel before Vlaakith.

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *Your parasites resonate. You feel Lae'zel's ecstasy as she moves to kneel before her queen.*
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Link to Lae'zel's parasite. Show her Vlaakith's mind.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Use the tadpole. Seek Vlaakith's mind through her psionic conveyance.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *Water and blood. They envelop you, they drag you downward. You are submerged in past, present, and future.*
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *Water and blood. They envelop you, they drag you downward. You are submerged in past, present, and future.*

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *Lae'zel believes a zaith'isk device cleanses the parasite - but it's used for extracting memories and killing the infected.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Vlaakith does not welcome her finest young warriors into her royal city to reward them, but to consume their essence in her quest for godhood.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *The lich queen doesn't intend to reward Lae'zel, but to devour her. Vlaakith speaks only in lies.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth. There is no cleansing, no ascension, no Chosen. Vlaakith will take Lae'zel's life essence for herself.*

131.text: *Your mind spins, your heart races. There is only endless void - and you are caught in the Undying Queen's orbit.*
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *Your mind spins, your heart races. There is only endless void - and you are caught in the Undying Queen's orbit.*
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

39.speaker: Vlaakith
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resounding only in player's head. The player grips their head in pain.

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: Damned fool. The wretched cannot sway the divine!
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel kneels to the Vlaakith hologram.

50.text: Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith. Your grace is my honour. Orpheus will die by my hand - and I will take my rightful place at your side.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel kneels to the Vlaakith hologram.

41.text: Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith. Your grace is my honour. Orpheus will die by my hand - and I will take my rightful place at your side.
41.context: NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith. Vlaakith's will above all

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.text: Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith. Your grace is my honour. Orpheus will die by my hand - and I will take my rightful place at your side.
105.context: NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith. Vlaakith's will above all

9.speaker: Vlaakith
9.text: One promise. One drop in the Astral Sea.

55.text: Do not fail me. For you would not survive the flood to follow.

23.speaker: Vlaakith
23.text: Do not fail me. For you would not survive the flood to follow.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel rises and the hologram flickers away

95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel rises and the hologram flickers away

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Voss was right, Vlaakith is your slaver. Denounce her - you must walk free.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: I will not entertain madness. Only in Vlaakith's might am I free!

52.text: I will not entertain madness. Only in Vlaakith's might am I free!

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: I will not entertain madness. Only in Vlaakith's might am I free!

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Go on, Lae'zel. Kneel before your god-queen.

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *Lae'zel's thoughts become yours. The sight of Orpheus looms over her mind; Voss' words echo within it. She means to forever turn her back on Vlaakith.*

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Kneel, Lae'zel. To be the god-queen's Chosen is an extraordinary honour.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: No. I have not cast off my chains only to be rebound.

99.text: No. I have not cast off my chains only to be rebound.

112.speaker: Lae'zel
112.text: No. I have not cast off my chains only to be rebound.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Connect with Lae'zel's parasite. 'Commander of Dragons. This is your destiny.'

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: *Lae'zel's doubts turn to rapture as she considers an eternity as Vlaakith's Chosen.*

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *Lae'zel's doubts turn to rapture as she considers an eternity as Vlaakith's Chosen.*

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: Baht t'Vlaakith. No githyanki's held the honour. My faith, almost lost to the dark winds -

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: How incredible, for them to carry it back.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Stand your ground. Don't fall for Vlaakith's lies.

64.speaker: Vlaakith
64.text: The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: [KP] The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.NodeContext: Feels betrayed by Vlaakith. Stands atraight and defiant. (tsk-VA)

81.speaker: Vlaakith
81.text: You are Hshar'lak. And still you speak my name.

135.speaker: Vlaakith
135.text: Vin'iisk. I am your Queen! Would you not bend in my honour?

126.text: Raise your eyes. Look upon She Who Conquers.

48.speaker: Vlaakith
48.text: Raise your eyes. Look upon She Who Conquers.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Who in the Hells are you?
4.context: NodeContext: her facade splinters a little, letting her mad, immortal rage take over

17.speaker: Vlaakith
17.context: NodeContext: her facade splinters a little, letting her mad, immortal rage take over

56.speaker: Vlaakith
56.text: I am Vlaakith. Undying Queen of the noble githyanki. God Regent of the Six Arms of Tu'narath.
56.context: NodeContext: anger should build rhythmically here, each consonant semi-spat in rage

88.speaker: Vlaakith
88.text: And you - you are abominations twice over. You carry ghaik parasites. And you harbour the Heretic Prince Orpheus.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: I've seen the captive Orpheus with my own eyes, spoken to Jhe'stil Kith'rak Voss. You lied to us, enslaved us.

15.speaker: Vlaakith
15.context: NodeContext: Absolute bonkers nuts for just a moment.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Glorious Vlaakith. I am unclean. I exhort you, grant me guidance.

79.speaker: Vlaakith
79.text: Return to the Astral Prism. Slay Orpheus the pretender.

119.speaker: Vlaakith
119.text: Kneel before me. Make your promise.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Get out of my camp. You're not welcome here.

111.speaker: Vlaakith
111.text: The Mistress of Castle Susurrus does not require invitation.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Look upon the figure with reverence.

59.speaker: Vlaakith
59.text: Vlaakith tavki na'zin. I am truth.
